Ug, what a day.

2004-03-12

I was stuck at my desk with absolutely no responsibilities... 8:30 to 5:15, with an hour off for lunch. Lunch was good, I made a quick veggie stew, but I was talking to a friend back home and hearing stuff that I had expected to hear, but it still stung a little. At least when I have nothing to do at school I can wander around, visit classes, practice piano. At the office I am stuck. I went to Google News with a feeling that something bad/big had happened in the world, and found out about Madrid. 3/11, sheeze... 2.5 years to the day. Clicking around I read quotes like this

Decir que "no hay palabras" es un tópico tan usado que ha perdido su significado. Pero es que, literalmente, hoy no encuentro en el diccionario nada con lo que nombrar a esta masacre.

from Escolar.net which provoked an unexpected response from me emotionally... It actually made me want to pack up my stuff and get out of Japan. Why? B/c I can read that. I can understand that. If those words/emotions were in Japanese I would be completely lost. So yeah, I'm feeling helpless about the freaking language yet again. I don't know any foreigners that communicate on that level. It's not just the language barrior; there are cultural issues as well. But the language, ah! Talk about being at a seemingly insurmountable plateau. I can't communicate at that level in Japanese, so I can't make meaningful conversation here, so my friendships are all shallow. Whatever level I'm at now with Japanese, I could get there in a few months if I were in Latin America (and then learn more!). So I want to to get back to Spanish now, after all these years.

These emotions can and will probably dissolve in a couple of days. Dissolve to what, though? Is my choice depression or numbness? I don't even want to post this now.
